articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Jiashu Liu
articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents:
About me
Hello! I’m currently a senior student double-major in Economics and Applied Math & Statistics at Macalester College, and will graduate in Spring 2022. I enjoy learning data visualization and R programming language. I’m also interested in the application of machine learning to economics, especially towards international trade topics.
Education
BA in Economics and Applied Math & Statistics, 2022
Macalester College

articles.title: Tidy Tuesday 2
articles.description: A new article created using the Distill format.
articles.contents:
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)





tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2021-09-21')



    Downloading file 1 of 1: `nominees.csv`

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2021, week = 39)



    Downloading file 1 of 1: `nominees.csv`

nominees <- tuesdata$nominees

# Or read in the data manually

nominees <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-09-21/nominees.csv')





library(tidyverse)    
library(lubridate)
library(ggthemes) 
library(plotly)
library(dplyr)



In the following steps, to explore the most recent trend, I first filter out the 2021 data from the entire Emmy Awards and Nominess dataset. I group the data by producer and type because I want to see the number of total shows each producer produced, and the distribution of Winner and Nominees in each production company. The colomn graph below shows that the Marvel Studio produced the most shows in 2021. However, most of the Marvel studio’s shows are nominees instead of winners. Shows produced by Netflix win the most Emmy Awards.


nominees2021<-nominees %>% 
  filter(year==2021) %>% 
  group_by(producer,type) %>% 
  summarise(producer_count=n())

nominees2021 %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=producer_count, y=fct_reorder(producer, producer_count, sum),fill=type, )) +
  geom_col()+
  labs(x="Total number of shows produced by each producer", y= "Producer")+
  theme(axis.text.y = element_text(size = 4))
